refers: POSITIONALLY-DEFINED COMPONENTIAL PART

stems.BSC: positionally-defined part/section of an entity (e.g., side, front, top, bottom, rear, etc.); to be a positionally-defined part/section of an entity
stems.CTE: The state/act of physically being/doing what a positionally-defined part/section of an entity is/does; to physically be/do what a positionally-defined part of an entity/is/does
stems.CSV: A/the (relative) spatial position/location which defines/delineates a part/section of an entity; to be a/the spatial position/location which defines/delineates a part/section of an entity
stems.OBJ: The entity of which the componential position is a part; to be the entity of which the componential part/section is a part

stems: Inalienable, inherent, inseparable “built-in” component part/section in relation to the whole
Alienable, separable, detachable component part/section in relation to the whole

refers: REAR/BACK PART OF AN ENTITY [RELATIVE TO ITS DIRECTIONAL ORIENTATION OR PRIMARY EXTERNAL INTERFACE]
TOP/PEAK/SUMMIT OF AN ENTITY [RELATIVE TO ITS TYPICAL ORIENTATION UNDER GRAVITY]
BOTTOM/FOUNDATION OF AN ENTITY [RELATIVE TO ITS TYPICAL ORIENTATION UNDER GRAVITY]
UPPER PART/“HALF” OF AN ENTITY [RELATIVE TO ITS TYPICAL ORIENTATION UNDER GRAVITY]
LOWER PART/“HALF” OF AN ENTITY [RELATIVE TO ITS TYPICAL ORIENTATION UNDER GRAVITY]
INTERIOR/INTERNAL VOLUME/“INSIDE(S)”/“INNARDS” OF AN ENTITY
LINEAR UNI-DIMENSIONAL MIDDLE, CENTER [AS SEEN PARALLEL TO LONG AXIS OF ENTITY (OR HEIGHT-AXIS OF A “TALL” ENTITY)]
LINEAR UNI-DIMENSIONAL MIDDLE, CENTER [AS SEEN PERPENDICULAR TO LONG AXIS OF ENTITY (OR HEIGHT-AXIS OF A “TALL” ENTITY)]
PLANAR 2-DIMENSIONAL MIDDLE, CENTER (RUNNING VERTICALLY AND LATERALLY PARALLEL TO LONG (OR TALL) SIDE OF ENTITY
PLANAR 2-DIMENSIONAL MIDDLE, CENTER [RUNNING VERTICALLY PARALLEL BUT LATERALLY PERPENDICULAR TO LONG (OR TALL) SIDE OF ENTITY]
PLANAR 2-DIMENSIONAL MIDDLE, CENTER [RUNNING VERTICALLY AND LATERALLY PERPENDICULAR TO LONG (OR TALL) SIDE OF ENTITY]
CENTER POINT OF ENTITY
notes: i.e., the zero-dimensional point most equidistant from all points on the periphery or surface of an entity

refers: SIDE/FLANK OF AN ENTITY
FRONT PART OF AN ENTITY [RELATIVE TO ITS DIRECTIONAL ORIENTATION OR PRIMARY EXTERNAL INTERFACE]
INTERIOR SURFACE/INTERNAL SURFACE/INSIDE SURFACE/“WALL” OF AN ENTITY
EXTERIOR/EXTERNAL SURFACE/“OUTSIDE”/“SKIN” OF AN ENTITY
EXTERNAL POINT-LIKE OUTWARD FACING VERTEX/“CORNER” OF AN ENTITY
EXTERNAL QUASI-LINEAR EDGE OF AN ENTITY
EXTERNAL QUASI-LINEAR JOINING OF SURFACES/“SEAM” OF AN ENTITY
EXTERNAL ATTACHMENT POINT OR FASTENING MECHANISM OF AN ENTITY
notes: i.e., handle, hook, latch, velcro patch, knob, peg, etc.

refers: INTERNAL POINT-LIKE INTERIOR VERTEX/“CORNER” OF AN ENTITY
EXTERNAL LINEAR OUTWARD-FACING “CORNER” EDGE OR “CORNER” SPACE OF ENTITY
INTERNAL LINEAR INTERIOR “CORNER” EDGE OR “CORNER” SPACE OF AN ENTITY
